text: This is step 1

title: New SIH project
text:
Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: New SIH project
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:


Code
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = mtcars, 
       aes(x = mpg, y = hp, 
           col = as.factor(cyl))) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme_minimal()





Code
1 + 1


[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


Code
2 * 2


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Introduction to Machine Learning with R and tidymodels
text:
Learning objectives

use exploratory data analysis to prepare for predictive modeling
explore which modeling approaches to use for different kinds of data
practice implementing supervised machine learning for classification and regression

title: Sydney Informatics Hub
text:
The Sydney Informatics Hub is a Core Research Facility of the University of Sydney.
The use of the SIH services including the Artemis HPC and associated support and training warrants acknowledgement in any publications, conference proceedings or posters describing work facilitated by these services.
The continued acknowledgement of the use of SIH facilities ensures the sustainability of our services.

title: Sydney Informatics Hub
text:
Suggested wording

General acknowledgement:
The authors acknowledge the technical assistance provided by the Sydney Informatics Hub, a Core Research Facility of the University of Sydney.


Acknowledging specific staff:
The authors acknowledge the technical assistance of (name of staff) of the Sydney Informatics Hub, a Core Research Facility of the University of Sydney.
For further information about acknowledging the Sydney Informatics Hub, please contact us at sih.info@sydney.edu.au.
